sect1.title: Tutorials
sect1.para: This section contains two tutorials demonstrating the use of JSure and SureLogic program annotations to assure the correct use of locks in two concurrent programs. The first tutorial uses a small closed-world example to demonstrate the complete assurance of a class and its usage, starting with no annotations at all. The second begins with a partially annotated program, and demonstrates more sophisticated concepts such as support for java.util.concurrent reader–writer locks.

These tutorials assume that you have installed JSure. If you see a JSure menu item on your Eclipse main menu than you can assume it has been installed properly. To follow along with the tutorials you will also need to add the BoundedFIFO and PlanetBaronJSure and BoundedFIFO projects to your workspace. From the Eclipse main menu, choose JSureRun JSure Tutorials and add the projects to your workspace as displayed in . If you don't want to add the project to your workspace this way, you can also download the BoundedFIFO project from http://www.surelogic.com/static/jsure/BoundedFIFO.zip or the PlanetBaronJSure project from http://www.surelogic.com/static/jsure/PlanetBaronJSure.zip and import them into your workspace manually. Note that the PlanetBaronJSure project will not compile without errors until you enable JSure which will add the promises.jar file to the project's build path (as described below).
